whatIs.title: What is embryo donation?
paragraphs: Embryo donation is a treatment for couples with poor or absent eggs and sperm. It is a commonly performed method in Cyprus.
It is often chosen when reproductive cells lose effectiveness with age and embryo donation offers a higher chance of success.

whoForWomen.title: Who is embryo donation suitable for?
items: Women of advanced age with diminished ovarian reserve and recurrent implantation failure or miscarriage,
Cases where embryos from own eggs are genetically unsuitable,
Women with low-quality eggs due to genetic conditions,
Young women with low AMH and/or high FSH (premature ovarian insufficiency),
Women who had chemotherapy or ovarian surgery/damage.
andAlsoItems: Those who had chemotherapy or gonadal removal/damage,
Men with sperm that cannot fertilize or develop healthy embryos,
Couples with combined male and female factor wishing to build a family through embryo donation.

similarity.title: Will the baby resemble you?
paragraphs: Pregnancy has benefits for women’s health; embryo donation can be a meaningful choice.
Experiencing pregnancy is a right for women who wish to become mothers. Science offers embryo donation to make this possible.
Egg and sperm donors are selected to match blood group and desired characteristics. After endometrial preparation, embryos are transferred ~17 days after medication starts.

processAyda.title: How does the process work at Ayda IVF?
paragraphs: A common question before IVF is: Will I get pregnant?
We strive as much as our patients do for success and work wholeheartedly for the best outcome.

whyCyprus.title: Why choose Cyprus?
paragraphs: Although presented as simple, embryo donation is detailed and requires dedication. Cyprus legally allows it and has strong expertise.
Marriage is not required. Cyprus offers one of the best cost–quality balances worldwide.
Patients often ask about success rates before treatment.
We value trust and communication and aim for the best possible process.
We work hard to maintain this trust and achieve high success by transferring top-quality embryos to an optimally prepared endometrium.

steps.title: Embryo donation in 7 steps
items: Contact us by phone or e-mail.
We learn your history and expectations.
We create a treatment plan and send required blood tests and documents.
After confirming eligibility, we take a partial payment to start the process.
Together we select the most suitable egg and sperm donors.
We initiate donor procedures and prepare your embryos.
Using fresh donor eggs takes about 20 days–2 months depending on donor matching and cycle days.
steps.note1: If you don’t want to wait, we can also offer ready embryo donation profiles.
steps.note2: Once high-quality embryos are confirmed, we inform you and start transfer preparation.

spermBanks.title: Which sperm banks do you use?
paragraphs: We import sperm from Denmark, home to Europe’s largest and most diverse sperm banks. We mainly work with European Sperm Bank and Cryos.
All sperm is certified and meets all negative test requirements of the TRNC Ministry of Health.
Before treatment you can choose your profile, view childhood photos (if available) and review extended donor details.

unsuitable.title: When might embryo donation be unsuitable?
paragraphs: If the recipient’s endometrium cannot carry a pregnancy, surrogacy may be required.
If the recipient has serious transmissible infections in serology, the procedure cannot be performed.
For recipients over 45, internal medicine and cardiology clearance (issued within the last 6 months) is required; if deemed risky, the procedure is not done.

pricing.title: How much does it cost? What is included?
includes: All donor treatment costs (drugs, visits, genetic and blood tests, etc.),
Selection and preparation of certified Danish sperm stored at our clinic,
Embryo creation and culture in our lab,
excludes: Recipient medications for preparation and ~2 months after transfer,
Required blood tests for the couple,
Post-transfer storage of surplus embryos (annual storage €600),
Any extra cost if a more premium sperm donor is requested beyond in-clinic options,
